snippet: Jeurys Familia had success this year with the quick pitch, a tactic he learned from the veteran LaTroy Hawkins in 2013. But in Game 1 of the World Series, Familia tried it on the wrong hitter.
abstract: New York Mets closer Jeurys Familia started using controversial quick pitch, which is meant to throw off batter’s timing, after watching former Mets relief pitcher LaTroy Hawkins in 2013; unfortunately Familia's attempt to use pitch in ninth inning of Game 1 of World Series against Kansas City Royals was disastrous, and Mets never fully recovered.
lead_paragraph: Jeurys Familia had success this year with the quick pitch, a tactic he learned from the veteran LaTroy Hawkins in 2013. But in Game 1 of the World Series, Familia tried it on the wrong hitter.

headline.main: For Mets, One Fateful Pitch Was Two Years in the Making
headline.print_headline: One Fateful Pitch, Two Years in the Making
